Class DataFrame

java.lang.Object
DataFrame
public class DataFrame extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • DataFrame

      public DataFrame(Object[][] data)
      Constructs a DataFrame from a 2D array of Objects.
      Parameters:
      data - The 2D array representing the DataFrame. The first row should contain column labels.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input data has fewer than one row or one column.

    • DataFrame

      public DataFrame(String[] columns_labels, Object[][] rows_values)
      Constructs a DataFrame from column labels and corresponding row values.
      Parameters:
      columns_labels - The labels of the columns.
      rows_values - The values of the rows, organized as a 2D array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of column labels is not equal to the number of columns in rows_values.

    • DataFrame

      public DataFrame(String filepath)
      Constructs a DataFrame from a csv file.
      Parameters:
      filepath - The path to the csv file.

    • DataFrame

      public DataFrame(String filepath, String delimiter)
      Constructs a DataFrame from a csv file and a delimiter.
      Parameters:
      filepath - The path to the csv file.
      delimiter - The Delimiter to split the csv columns.

  • Method Details

    • getColumnLabels

      public ArrayList<String> getColumnLabels()
      Returns a list of column labels in the DataFrame.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the column labels.

    • getRows

      public ArrayList<Object[]> getRows()
      Retrieves the rows stored in this ArrayList. Each row is represented as an array of Objects.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing arrays of Objects representing rows.

    • getColumnValues

      public ArrayList<Object> getColumnValues(String columnName)
      Returns a list of values of the column with the given label.
      Parameters:
      columnName - The label of the column.
      Returns:
      A list containing the values of the specified column.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the column with the given label does not exist.

    • getRowValues

      public ArrayList<Object> getRowValues(int index)
      Returns an ArrayList containing the values of the row at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the row.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the values of the row.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel(int index)
      Returns a label of the row at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the row.
      Returns:
      A String
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • getLabels

      public Object[] getLabels()
      Returns all the labels in the dataframe.
      Returns:
      A list of strings

    • printDataFrame

      public void printDataFrame()
      Prints the DataFrame to the console. The DataFrame is printed in a tabular format with column labels and corresponding row values.

    • head

      public void head(int numberOfRows)
      Prints the first few rows of a tabular data structure, including column labels. The number of rows to display is specified by the parameter numberOfRows.
      Parameters:
      numberOfRows - The number of rows to display from the beginning of the data structure.

    • tail

      public void tail(int numberOfRows)
      Prints the last few rows of a tabular data structure, including column labels. The number of rows to display is specified by the parameter numberOfRows.
      Parameters:
      numberOfRows - The number of rows to display from the end of the data structure.

    • iloc

      public DataFrame iloc(int[] indices)
      Returns a new DataFrame containing rows specified by the given array of indices.
      Parameters:
      indices - An array of indices indicating which rows to select.
      Returns:
      A new DataFrame containing selected rows.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if indices is empty.

    • loc

      public DataFrame loc(String[] lab)
      Returns a new DataFrame containing columns specified by the given array of labels.
      Parameters:
      lab - An array of labels indicating which columns to select.
      Returns:
      A new DataFrame containing selected columns.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if lab is empty, or label is not present in DataFrame.

    • filter

      public DataFrame filter(ArrayList<String> columnNames, ArrayList<Object> filterValues)
      Filters the DataFrame based on given column names and filter values.
      Parameters:
      columnNames - The list of column names to filter on.
      filterValues - The list of filter values corresponding to each column.
      Returns:
      A new DataFrame containing only the rows that match the filters.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of column names and filter values don't match.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. Two DataFrames are considered equal if they have the same number of rows and columns, and if the elements in corresponding positions in their rows are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The reference object with which to compare.
      Returns:
      true if this DataFrame is equal to the obj argument; false otherwise.

    • moyenne

      public Object[] moyenne()
      Calculates the mean (average) of numerical values in each column of the DataFrame. If a column contains non-numerical values or is empty, the mean value for that column is considered null.
      Returns:
      An array containing the mean values for each column in the DataFrame.

    • count

      public Integer[] count()
      Counts the non-null elements in each column of the DataFrame.
      Returns:
      An array containing the count of non-null elements for each column in the DataFrame.

    • minEtMax

      public Object[][] minEtMax()
      Finds the minimum and maximum values in each numerical column of the DataFrame. If a column contains non-numerical values, the minimum and maximum values for that column are considered null.$
      Returns:
      A 2D array where the first row contains the minimum values and the second row contains the maximum values

    • sd

      public Object[] sd(Object[] mean)
      Calculates the standard deviation of numerical values in each column of the DataFrame based on the provided means. If a column contains non-numerical values, the standard deviation for that column is considered null.
      Parameters:
      mean - An array containing the mean values for each column in the DataFrame.
      Returns:
      An array containing the standard deviation values for each column in the DataFrame.

    • describe

      public void describe()
      Generates a summary of the DataFrame, including count, mean, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation for each column.

    • groupby

      public DataFrame groupby(String label, String option)

    • meanForGroupBy

      public static double meanForGroupBy(Object[] nb)

    • sumForGroupBy

      public static double sumForGroupBy(Object[] nb)
